results.summary: Police are given more time to speak to a man arrested in connection with the murder of an 18-year-old rapper in Birmingham.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/5fb11600-58ca-624d-a506-dcd005a8d559"><image id="70066388"/><paragraph role="introduction">Police have been given more time to speak to a man arrested in connection with the murder of a rapper.</paragraph><paragraph>Joshua Ribera, 18, died in hospital after he was stabbed outside TC's club in Selly Oak, Birmingham, on Friday.</paragraph><paragraph>Officers have been granted an extra 36 hours to question an 18-year-old who handed himself in to Dudley police station at 11:45 BST on Saturday.</paragraph><paragraph>An 19-year-old from Edgbaston, arrested after attending Bloxwich Police Station on Sunday, remains in custody.</paragraph><paragraph>Investigations into the stabbing are continuing, West Midlands Police said. </paragraph><paragraph>Mr Ribera, who was a rapper from the Moseley area of Birmingham, used the stage name Depzman.</paragraph><paragraph>A post-mortem examination revealed he died from a stab wound to the heart.</paragraph><crosshead>'Stay strong'</crosshead><paragraph>Police were called to Coronation Road just before 23:00 BST on Friday by the ambulance service. </paragraph><paragraph>The attack came after an event in memory of <!-- CPS Asset ID: 24214631 --><link><caption>Kyle Sheehan</caption><altText>Link to the previous story</altText><url platform="highweb" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-19769384"/></link> who was stabbed in the leg in the Bartley Green area of Birmingham on 21 September 2012.</paragraph><paragraph>Anyone who was at TC's on Friday night or who witnessed the stabbing is urged to call police as soon as possible.</paragraph><paragraph>Friends and <!-- CPS Asset ID: 24214632 --><link><caption>people from across the music industry</caption><url platform="highweb" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/24206027"/></link> lined up to pay tribute to Mr Ribera.</paragraph><paragraph>One friend, Jay Kae, said: "Everyone loved him. A lot of people are hurting.</paragraph><paragraph>"I feel a bit lost. I'm just trying to stay strong for Depz's mum and the rest of the family.</paragraph><paragraph>"I hear of people getting stabbed all the time so I didn't think it was as serious as it actually was until I got there [to the club]."</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/5fb11600-58ca-624d-a506-dcd005a8d559"><paragraph>Police have been given more time to speak to a man arrested in connection with the murder of a rapper.</paragraph><paragraph>Joshua Ribera, 18, died in hospital after he was stabbed outside TC's club in Selly Oak, Birmingham, on Friday.</paragraph><paragraph>Officers have been granted an extra 36 hours to question an 18-year-old who handed himself in to Dudley police station at 11:45 BST on Saturday.</paragraph><paragraph>An 19-year-old from Edgbaston, arrested after attending Bloxwich Police Station on Sunday, remains in custody.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

70066388.caption: The stabbing happened outside TC's in the Selly Oak area of Birmingham

items.summary: A second man is arrested on suspicion of the murder of an 18-year-old rapper in Birmingham on Friday night.
items.headline: Joshua Ribera: Second arrest in murder investigation
items.shortHeadline: Second arrest over rapper stab death

items.summary: An 18-year-old rapper is stabbed to death in Birmingham after attending a tribute event to a knife murder victim.
items.headline: Rapper Depzman stabbed to death after Kyle Sheehan tribute
